hero.headline: Apple Research App
hero.subhead: Join groundbreaking health studies from your iPhone and Apple Watch.
hero.summary: Developed the core system architecture for the Apple Research App, empowering participants to enroll in longitudinal studies and securely share sensor data with researchers at Harvard, the National Institutes of Health, and the University of Michigan.

assets.heroAlt: Abstract gradient suggesting the Apple Research app

metrics.label: People contributing to health studies with Apple Watch and iPhone.
Environmental sound exposure recorded for the Apple Hearing Study.
Collaborations with Harvard T.H. Chan School, the National Institutes of Health, and the University of Michigan.

highlights.label: Privacy‑first data collection
highlights.description: Designed high‑fidelity sensor pipelines with encryption and participant controls.

highlights.label: Scientific partnerships
highlights.description: Collaborated with researchers from Harvard, NIH, and the University of Michigan to design studies and run clinical validation.

highlights.label: Remote research tools
highlights.description: Built surveys, tasks, and reminders that turn iPhone and Apple Watch into portable study kits.

references.title: Research app — Apple
references.excerpt: Apple invites over 350,000 people to contribute to groundbreaking studies using Apple Watch and iPhone.

references.title: New Insights on Tinnitus Revealed in Apple Hearing Study
references.excerpt: The University of Michigan’s Apple Hearing Study involves more than 160,000 participants and has collected hundreds of millions of hours of environmental sound data.

hero.headline: Smart Stack Workout Suggestions
hero.subhead: Context‑aware workout suggestions on the Apple Watch home interface.
hero.summary: Contributed to the Smart Stack workout suggestions in watchOS 26, designing on‑device logic to present relevant exercise recommendations based on motion and routine patterns.

metrics.label: Introduced with the Apple Watch redesign in 2025.
Workout suggestions computed locally for privacy and responsiveness.
Smart Stack uses motion, location and routines to suggest workouts at the right time.

highlights.label: Sensor‑driven timing
highlights.description: Used motion, time of day and location signals to determine when to suggest a workout.

highlights.label: Design collaboration
highlights.description: Worked with design teams to build glanceable cards using WidgetKit.

highlights.label: Privacy‑first
highlights.description: Kept all recommendation logic on device to protect user data.

references.title: watchOS 10 introduces Smart Stack
references.excerpt: watchOS 10 introduces Smart Stack, delivering relevant widgets just when users need them.

references.title: watchOS 26 delivers more personalized ways to stay active and connected
references.excerpt: In watchOS 26, the Smart Stack becomes even more proactive by using contextual data, sensor data, and routines to provide hints — for example, suggesting a Pilates workout when you arrive at a studio at your usual time.

references.title: Design widgets for watchOS
references.excerpt: Discover how Smart Stack surfaces timely widgets to help people take action in the moment.

hero.headline: Journal for iPhone
hero.subhead: Personal reflection, protected by Apple’s privacy architecture.
hero.summary: Contributed to Apple’s Journal app for iOS 17.2, giving iPhone users a private place to record everyday moments with on‑device intelligence creating personalized prompts.

metrics.label: Launched in December 2023 as part of the iOS 17.2 update.
Suggestions engine runs entirely on device to surface relevant entries from photos, workouts and other activities.
Introduced a Journaling Suggestions API for developers.

highlights.label: Rich media entries
highlights.description: Create memories with text, photos, videos, audio recordings and locations.

highlights.label: On‑device suggestions
highlights.description: Personalized prompts generated with on‑device machine learning and customizable notifications.

highlights.label: Privacy & security
highlights.description: Entries are end‑to‑end encrypted and can be locked with Face ID or Touch ID.

highlights.label: Journaling Suggestions API
highlights.description: Third‑party apps can suggest journaling moments while respecting user privacy.

references.title: Journal helps iPhone users reflect on everyday moments
references.excerpt: The Journal app uses on‑device machine learning to create personalized suggestions and supports photos, videos, audio recordings, locations and more.

references.title: Apple’s new Journal app is now available with the release of iOS 17.2
references.excerpt: The Journal app lets users capture moments with text, photos, videos, audio recordings and locations, and uses on‑device AI to provide personalized suggestions; all entries are end‑to‑end encrypted and a Journaling Suggestions API lets third‑party apps suggest moments.

references.title: Apple’s Journal app arrives with thoughtful design
references.excerpt: Journal helps users reflect on everyday moments with deep integrations across the iPhone experience.

hero.headline: AirPods Pro Hearing Aid Mode
hero.summary: Collaborated across engineering and research teams to create Apple’s first FDA‑authorized over‑the‑counter hearing aid software for AirPods Pro 2, delivering personalized amplification after an iPhone‑based hearing test.

metrics.label: First over‑the‑counter hearing aid software cleared in September 2024.
Clinical study found the self‑fitting method provided similar benefits to professionally fitted hearing aids.
Pure‑tone audiometry on iPhone builds a personal hearing profile in about five minutes.

highlights.label: Personalized amplification
highlights.description: Transforms AirPods Pro into a clinical‑grade hearing aid by boosting frequencies according to your hearing profile.

highlights.label: Validated self‑fitting
highlights.description: Clinical study with 118 participants showed comparable performance to professionally fitted hearing aids.

highlights.label: Hearing health suite
highlights.description: Integrated with hearing test and hearing protection features for a seamless hearing health experience.

references.title: Apple introduces groundbreaking health features
references.excerpt: Apple’s new hearing aid capability for AirPods Pro uses the hearing test’s personalized profile to dynamically adjust sounds, providing a clinical‑grade over‑the‑counter hearing aid.

references.title: FDA authorizes the first over‑the‑counter hearing aid software device
references.excerpt: The FDA cleared a self‑fitting software hearing aid for mild to moderate hearing loss based on a study with 118 participants, showing comparable benefits to professionally fitted hearing aids.

references.title: AirPods Pro hearing health experience
references.excerpt: AirPods Pro provide a hearing test built on pure‑tone audiometry that takes a few minutes to complete and creates a personalized hearing profile used to recommend the hearing aid feature; all test data is stored privately on device.

hero.headline: Apple Fitness on Every iPhone
hero.subhead: Unlocking activity tracking without requiring Apple Watch.
hero.summary: Worked across teams to open up the Fitness app to all iPhone users in iOS 16, enabling activity tracking and Move rings without requiring an Apple Watch.

metrics.label: Made the Fitness app available to all iPhone users in 2022.
Track steps, distance, flights climbed and third‑party workouts to fill your daily Move goal using only iPhone motion sensors.
Share your Move ring progress with friends for motivation.

highlights.label: Workouts tab
highlights.description: iPhone-native Workouts tab to start runs, cycling, HIIT, and more directly on the phone.

highlights.label: Sensor handoff
highlights.description: Coordinated data flows between iPhone, Apple Watch, Bluetooth heart-rate monitors, and AirPods.

highlights.label: Activity integration
highlights.description: Counts steps, distance, and flights climbed to fill the Move ring even without a watch.

references.title: You can use the iOS 16 Fitness app for activity tracking without an Apple Watch
references.excerpt: With iOS 16, the iPhone’s motion sensors track steps, distance and third‑party workouts to estimate calories burned, letting users set a daily Move goal even without an Apple Watch.

references.title: Apple is making the Fitness app available to all iPhone users
references.excerpt: The Fitness app quantifies your steps, distance and flights climbed into active calories, lets you set a Move goal, ingests workouts from third‑party apps, and lets you share your Move ring with friends.
